commit_message:
remove unnecessary masks in ConcatEven/Odd, thanks @ag01. Fixes #1146

PiperOrigin-RevId: 511734168

issues.title: Use of masked variant of permute instructions on AVX2/AVX512 in ConcatEven/Odd functions
issues.body:
Hi,

I see that the ConcatEven/Odd implementations in AVX2/AVX512 use the masked variant of the permute intrinsic (e.g. _mm512_mask2_permute_*) - with the mask used simply containing all 1s.

Using GCC 7.5 - this results in extra instructions for setting up and using the mask register, see here: https://godbolt.org/z/j9bhc3oer

This doesn't seem to occur using GCC 8 and above (as I presume it is optimised away, and the non-masked variant is used).

I'd be interested to know if there was any reason for the implementation using the masked variant.

Many thanks
